Package com.bbn.ccast.sim

Class TimeServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bbn.ccast.sim.TimeServer
  • public class TimeServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Time server that allows for time scales other than 1.0. (-For faster-than-real-time simulation, for example.)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TimeServer()
      Make one - real-time by default.
      TimeServer​(double timeScale)
      Make one that is not real-time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      long currentTimeMillis()
      If isRealTime, simply default to System.currentTimeMillis().
      double getTimeScale()  
      void setTimeScale​(double timeScale)  

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeServer

        public TimeServer()
        Make one - real-time by default.

      • TimeServer

        public TimeServer​(double timeScale)
        Make one that is not real-time.
        Parameters:
        timeScale - The rate at which time should progress, with 1.0 matching real time.

    • Method Detail

      • currentTimeMillis

        public long currentTimeMillis()
        If isRealTime, simply default to System.currentTimeMillis().

        Otherwise, calculate the milliseconds from the epoch as if we started at the real time when the object was made and moved time forward from there at the rate specified in timeScale.

        Returns:
        milliseconds from the epoch, if #isRealTime, else milliseconds from the epoch scaled by timeScale starting when the object was made.

      • getTimeScale

        public double getTimeScale()

      • setTimeScale

        public void setTimeScale​(double timeScale)
